intro: Carissa scabra, commonly known as the rough carissa, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It features woody stems covered in small, spiny tubercles, giving it a distinctive, rugged appearance. The plant produces clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit is a yellow, fleshy berry that turns red when ripe, containing several seeds. Carissa scabra is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
